name: Prowler
summary: Prowler is an open-source security tool for AWS, Azure, GCP, and Kubernetes to do security assessments, audits, incident response, compliance, continuous monitoring, hardening, forensics readiness, and operational best practices.

notes: Focus on S3 security checks only

steps.title: Configure AWS credentials
steps.details: Set up AWS CLI credentials with appropriate IAM permissions

steps.title: Run comprehensive assessment
steps.details: Execute Prowler against all AWS services

steps.title: Review findings
steps.details: Analyze generated reports for security issues

CloudTrail is properly configured for auditing
IAM user has console access - consider programmatic only

name: ScoutSuite
summary: ScoutSuite is a multi-cloud security auditing tool. Security auditors can use it to evaluate the security posture of their cloud environments.

steps.title: Configure cloud credentials
steps.details: Set up credentials for each cloud provider
steps.command: # AWS: aws configure, Azure: az login, GCP: gcloud auth login

steps.title: Run cloud-specific scans
steps.command: scout azure && scout gcp && scout aws

steps.title: Review findings
steps.details: Analyze HTML reports for security issues

stages.command: # Use diff tools on JSON outputs

name: CloudMapper
summary: CloudMapper helps you analyze your Amazon Web Services (AWS) environments. It was originally created by Duo Security and is now maintained by the community.

notes: Collects configuration data from AWS account

name: Pacu
summary: Pacu is an AWS exploitation framework, designed for testing the security of Amazon Web Services environments.

notes: Check current AWS identity and permissions

name: MicroBurst
summary: MicroBurst is a collection of scripts for assessing Microsoft Azure security.

summary: GCP-Enum is a multi-threaded GCP security enumeration tool designed to make GCP security testing more efficient.

name: AWS CLI
summary: The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) is a unified tool to manage AWS services from the command line and automate them through scripts.

steps.detail: Download AWS CLI MSI from https://awscli.amazonaws.com/AWSCLIV2.msi

notes: Enter access key, secret key, region, and output format
Shows account ID, user ARN, and username

steps.title: List all users
steps.details: Enumerate IAM users in the account

steps.title: Check current permissions
steps.details: List attached policies for current user

steps.title: Test role assumption
steps.details: Attempt to assume a privileged role

stages.label: Initial Access
stages.description: Establish AWS credentials and verify access

stages.label: Enumeration
stages.description: Map IAM users, roles, policies, and permissions

stages.label: Storage Assessment
stages.description: Check S3 buckets and other storage for misconfigurations

output_notes.meaning: Insufficient permissions for the requested operation
The specified S3 bucket does not exist
The AWS access key ID is invalid

operational_tips: Configure multiple profiles for different accounts
Use aws-vault for secure credential management
Enable CLI output paging with aws configure set cli_pager ""

advanced_usage.title: Multi-account enumeration script
advanced_usage.scenario: Enumerate IAM across multiple AWS accounts
advanced_usage.command: for profile in $(aws configure list-profiles); do echo "=== $profile ==="; aws --profile $profile iam list-users --query 'Users[*].UserName'; done
notes: Requires configured profiles for each account
Use jq for better JSON parsing

advanced_usage.title: Privilege escalation path finder
advanced_usage.command: aws iam list-attached-user-policies --user-name $USER | jq -r '.AttachedPolicies[].PolicyArn' | xargs -I {} aws iam list-policy-versions --policy-arn {} --query 'Versions[?IsDefaultVersion==`true`].Document' | jq '.Statement[] | select(.Effect=="Allow") | .Action[]'
notes: Parses policy documents to find allowed actions
Focus on iam:*, sts:*, and ec2:* permissions

resources.label: AWS CLI Documentation
resources.description: Official AWS CLI documentation and guides

resources.label: AWS IAM Best Practices
resources.description: AWS Identity and Access Management best practices

name: Azure CLI
summary: The Azure Command-Line Interface (CLI) is a cross-platform command-line tool to connect to Azure and execute administrative commands on Azure resources.

installation_guides.summary: Install via package manager or script

steps.detail: Invoke-WebRequest -Uri https://aka.ms/installazurecliwindows -OutFile .\AzureCLI.msi; Start-Process msiexec.exe -Wait -ArgumentList '/I AzureCLI.msi /quiet'; rm .\AzureCLI.msi

notes: Displays information about the signed-in user

steps.title: List role assignments
steps.details: Discover role assignments at subscription level
steps.command: az role assignment list --all --query '[].{Principal:principalName, Role:roleDefinitionName, Scope:scope}'

stages.label: Authentication
stages.description: Login and verify access to Azure tenant

stages.label: Identity Enumeration
stages.description: Map Azure AD users, groups, and service principals

stages.label: Resource Assessment
stages.description: Check storage, VMs, and other resources

output_notes.meaning: The specified resource does not exist

operational_tips: Use az account set --subscription to switch contexts
Configure default output format with az configure
Enable Azure CLI extensions for additional functionality

advanced_usage.title: Comprehensive RBAC enumeration
advanced_usage.scenario: Map all role assignments across subscriptions
advanced_usage.command: for sub in $(az account list --query '[].id' -o tsv); do echo "=== Subscription: $sub ==="; az role assignment list --subscription $sub --all --query '[].{Principal:principalName, Role:roleDefinitionName}'; done
notes: Use jq for complex JSON processing

advanced_usage.title: Azure AD user privilege analysis
advanced_usage.command: az role assignment list --all --query "[?roleDefinitionName=='Owner' || roleDefinitionName=='Contributor'].{User:principalName, Role:roleDefinitionName, Scope:scope}"
notes: Focus on Owner and Contributor roles
Check scope to understand assignment level

resources.label: Azure RBAC Best Practices
resources.description: Azure Role-Based Access Control best practices

name: Google Cloud CLI
summary: The Google Cloud CLI is a set of tools to create and manage Google Cloud resources from the command line.

installation_guides.summary: Install via package manager or tarball

notes: Sets up authentication and default project

steps.title: Check service account keys
steps.details: List keys for a service account
steps.command: gcloud iam service-accounts keys list --iam-account SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL

steps.title: Test impersonation
steps.details: Attempt to impersonate a service account

stages.label: IAM Mapping
stages.description: Enumerate service accounts, roles, and permissions

stages.label: Resource Analysis
stages.description: Assess storage, compute, and other resources

output_notes.meaning: Insufficient IAM permissions for the operation
The requested resource does not exist

operational_tips: Use gcloud config set project to set default project
Enable command completion with gcloud components install
Configure multiple configurations for different projects

advanced_usage.title: Multi-project IAM enumeration
advanced_usage.scenario: Scan IAM across all accessible projects
advanced_usage.command: for project in $(gcloud projects list --format='value(projectId)'); do echo "=== Project: $project ==="; gcloud projects get-iam-policy $project --format='table(bindings.role,bindings.members)'; done

advanced_usage.title: Service account privilege analysis
advanced_usage.scenario: Identify service accounts with high privileges
advanced_usage.command: gcloud projects get-iam-policy PROJECT_ID --flatten='bindings[].members[]' --filter='bindings.role:roles/owner OR bindings.role:roles/editor' --format='table(bindings.role,bindings.members)'
notes: Focus on owner and editor roles
Check for service accounts with broad permissions

resources.label: GCP IAM Best Practices
resources.description: Google Cloud Identity and Access Management best practices
